page.title: 17Religion In Notgrove
page.content: Notgrove's Anglican Parish Church of St. Bartholomew is regularly attended by a congregation of about 15 for the three Church Services per month. First Sunday is Evensong at 6pm, Second Sunday is a Family Service and the Fourth Sunday is Holy Communion, both at 10am. The Reverend James Hughs, who lives in the next village of Cold Aston officiates, and is much loved by the villagers. He fears that when he retires, which may be soon, the 3 parishes he administers will be split, and each added to neighbouring Livings. For Mothers union and Sunday School, parishioners have to leave the village. Roman Catholics, Baptists and Methodists have to travel to Bourton- on-the-Water, a distance of about 6km.
